instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00134: What is 820-00134? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: A1419 ? <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5K EMC 2834 - No Image
threads.message:
[FONT=Calibri]Hi,[/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]I have a couple of 27? 2015 IMacs that have pretty much the same issue.[/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]They both came in with 1 light illuminated on the logic board. Usually this can be a short somewhere, but what I found was <TRANSISTOR>Q8470</TRANSISTOR> being faulty.[/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]There as a 1V drop across this FET, meaning [FONT=Courier New]<SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_FET_P12V_S5</SIGNAL> was low.[/FONT][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]I jumpered across this FET, and the board was fully alive in terms of voltages.[/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]We now have 2 x diagnostic LEDs alive and LE0305 - LE0307 illuminated. [/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]<SIGNAL>P1V0_S3_PWRGD</SIGNAL> [/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]<SIGNAL>CPUVCC_S0_PWRGD</SIGNAL> [/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]<SIGNAL>VCCIO_S0_PWRGD</SIGNAL> [/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]The above are all good[/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]I have all GPU voltages, but the board will not post. No chime.[/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]<SIGNAL>GFX_OK_L</SIGNAL> is high & <SIGNAL>DP_LINK_OK</SIGNAL> is missing. Which is generated by a GPIO on the GPU, both are required for the third diagnostic LED.[/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]So being out of ideas and not finding anything knock of the board I went into full brain dead mode and started trying different bios files from where ever I could find them i.e. Vinifix?[/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]No change at all. I haven?t really come across too many slimline macs with dying/dead GPUs. And so far, none on the 2015 AMD R395X.[/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]I haven?t roasted this GPU to see if it will come back to life as of yet?no point since I can?t find replacement GPUs for this model. [/FONT]

[FONT=Calibri]Any ideas, I?m still thinking vBIOS, so if anyone has a known good bios file, I would appreciate any insight.

I have attached the original bios, if anyone would care to have a look.

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fPJUfe9Vec0wiFWBAsXj0hp_-FHXiAJ9/view?usp=sharing[/url][/FONT]

Thanks in advance

threads.title: A1419 ? <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5K EMC 2834 - No Image
threads.message:
Leakage on <TRANSISTOR>Q8470</TRANSISTOR>, change it first.
I never found other problem on a board with similar MOSFET leakage.

threads.title: A1419 ? <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5K EMC 2834 - No Image
threads.message:
Still stuck on this one.I have replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8470</TRANSISTOR>, I still have exactly the same fault

So i roasted the GPU to about 150C, ( i was clean out of ideas)

We're still missing <SIGNAL>DP_LINK_OK</SIGNAL>. I'm only persevering as i`ve had about 4 of these with same fault

Any ideas, would you go for a GPU swap at this point ? I'm happy to take one for the team and see where this ends up. However the availability of 216-0872024 is non existent.

Ideas welcome ??

Thanks

threads.title: A1419 ? <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5K EMC 2834 - No Image
threads.message:
After changed <TRANSISTOR>Q8470</TRANSISTOR>, which volatges appear on the board?
Check entire power on sequence...
